description: A mysterious weapon from the 1960s, the Dardick revolver would best be considered the bastard child of a revolver and a mag-fed handgun. With a 13-tround internal magazine, plus two chambers with a tround in them at any given time, the 1500 has an impressive capacity; Very impressive for a revolver. Under 100 of these were made between the 3 models originally, until a company known as the Tefnut Armanent Company, or TAC, purchased the rights to make both replicas of the classic, and remastered versions thereof.

A mysterious weapon from the 1960s, the Dardick revolver would best be considered the bastard child of a revolver and a mag-fed handgun. With a 11-tround internal magazine, plus two chambers with a tround in them at any given time, the 1100 is a more compact version than the later 1500. Under 100 of these were made between the 3 models originally, until a company known as the Tefnut Armanent Company, or TAC, purchased the rights to make both replicas of the classic, and remastered versions thereof.

A mysterious weapon from the 1960s, the Dardick revolver would best be considered the bastard child of a revolver and a mag-fed handgun. With a whopping 20 tround double-stack internal magazine, plus two chambers with a tround in them at any given time, the 2000 has an impressive capacity of 22 trounds total; unheard of for a revolver. The 2000 was the rarest of the 3 original models of dardick; Under 100 of these were made between the 3 models originally, and only one 2000 model, until a company known as the Tefnut Armanent Company, or TAC, purchased the rights to make both replicas of the classic, and remastered versions thereof.
A Dardick model 1500 revolver, with the Switch Hitter carbine kit installed, turning it into a rifle. A longer barrel length and a stock make it a far more accurate, and longe range, variant.
A Dardick model 1100 revolver, with the Switch Hitter carbine kit installed, turning it into a rifle. A longer barrel length and a stock make it a far more accurate, and longe range, variant.
A Dardick model 2000 revolver, with the Switch Hitter carbine kit installed, turning it into a rifle. A longer barrel length and a stock make it a far more accurate, and longe range, variant.

Based on the Dardick Model 2000 revolver, the Tefnut Armanent Company designed this carbine in the year 2078. Using some mechanical tricks, they turned the tround-based revolver into a carbine with burst-fire capability and modern attachment points. While TAC intended it to simply be a range toy of a SMG, the gun's high capacity for it's size made it a favorite among some niche survivalist circles.
